intro: Mammillaria tenuis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hedgehog cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a low-growing cactus with cylindrical stems that are covered in white, woolly hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for succulent enthusiasts.
